subclassFeature.name: Runesmith
entries: A Runesmith specializes in inscribing ancient runes to protect allies, empower weapons, and ward against threats.

subclassFeature.name: Forged for War
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Martial Weapons|XPHB|Martial weapons} and {@item Heavy Armor|XPHB|Heavy armor}.
In addition, when you craft weapons or armor, the amount of time required to craft it is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Rune
entries: You use your Intelligence as your Attack and Damage Bonus instead of Strength.

subclassFeature.name: Runesmith Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the {@table Runesmith Spells|FFT} table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Inscription
entries: You gain the ability to inscribe runes, mystical symbols that store and unleash your spells through enchanted objects. The amount of runes inscribed counts towards the amount of items you can create with the {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|2|XUA2024Artificer} feature.

entries.name: Inscribing a Rune
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can inscribe one rune into a weapon, piece of armor, or object at least the size of a rune. A rune stores one spell and each rune is able to cast.

When inscribing the rune, you can improve it using a {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|2|XUA2024Artificer} slot to increase the spell's level. The spell's level can be increased by a number of levels equal to half your Artificer level. The spell cannot be upcast further than 9th level.

entries.name: Using Runes
entries: A rune can be activated as part of the action to cast the stored spell. You don't expend a spell slot when casting a spell this way. The spell uses your Artificer spell ability for attack rolls and saving throws.
Each rune has one charge. At 12th level, runes gain two charges. At 20th level, they gain three charges. Once all charges are used, the rune becomes inert until it is recharged.

entries.name: Recharging Runes
entries: All expended rune charges are restored when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

subclassFluff.name: Runesmith
entries: {@i Inscribe Ancient Power Through Mystical Runes}

A Runesmith is an Artificer that has narrowed their focus to working a specific language of magic - powerful Runes that can channel long lasting power. These Runes come in many shapes and forms, the lore behind from many sources.

A Runesmith can be a warrior, his runes splashed with gleaming power across his armor, or a scholar lending their power to their companions or even a strange tattooed mystic, their runes tattooed across their very body.
Runesmiths are not inherently good or evil, though their rigorous attention to detail and patience tend to make them more inclined to a Lawful perspective.

entries.name: Design Note: Runesmith Origin
entries: The Runesmith is an Artificer subclass that channels magic through ancient runic inscriptions. Unlike the explosive Artillerist, the Runesmith focuses on protective and empowering runes:

items.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: grants proficiency with Calligrapher's Supplies and allows faster crafting of magic scrolls.

items.name: Runic Sigil
entries: creates a magical construct inscribed with protective or offensive runes that can shield allies, empower attacks, or ward against enemies.

items.name: Explosive Rune
entries: allows your sigils to detonate with runic power and increases their effectiveness.
